    • isValidPath

      public static boolean isValidPath(String path)
      Validates if a path is correctly formatted
      Parameters:
      path - Path to validate
      Returns:
      true if the path is valid, false otherwise

    • addElement

      public JsonDot addElement(String path, Object value) throws org.json.JSONException
      Adds a value at the specified path using dot notation, auto-creating missing paths
      Parameters:
      path - Dot notation path (e.g., "parent1.parent2.child")
      value - Value to add
      Returns:
      this JsonDot instance for method chaining
      Throws:
      org.json.JSONException - if the path is invalid

    • removeElementFromAllPaths

      public List<Object> removeElementFromAllPaths(String path) throws org.json.JSONException
      Removes an element at all matching paths using dot notation
      Parameters:
      path - Dot notation path (e.g., "*.child" or "parent1.parent2.child")
      Returns:
      List of removed values
      Throws:
      org.json.JSONException - if the path is invalid

    • removeElementFromPath

      public Object removeElementFromPath(String path) throws org.json.JSONException
      Removes an element at the specified path using dot notation
      Parameters:
      path - Dot notation path (e.g., "parent1.parent2.child")
      Returns:
      The removed value, or null if not found
      Throws:
      org.json.JSONException - if the path is invalid

      Returns:

      Throws:

    • getObject

      public JsonDot getObject(String path) throws org.json.JSONException
      Gets a JSON object at the specified path using dot notation
      Parameters:
      path - Dot notation path (e.g., "parent1.parent2.child")
      Returns:
      JsonDot instance containing the JSON object
      Throws:
      org.json.JSONException - if the path is invalid or element is not a JSON object

    • getArray

      public JsonArrayDot getArray(String path) throws org.json.JSONException
      Gets a JSON array at the specified path using dot notation
      Parameters:
      path - Dot notation path (e.g., "parent1.parent2.child")
      Returns:
      JsonArrayDot instance containing the JSON array
      Throws:
      org.json.JSONException - if the path is invalid or element is not a JSON array

    • hasPath

      public boolean hasPath(String path)
      Checks if a path exists in the JSON object. The path can include array indices like "parent1.array[0].child" or wildcards like "parent1.array[*].child".
      Parameters:
      path - The path to check
      Returns:
      true if the path exists, false otherwise

    • suggestPaths

      public List<String> suggestPaths(String partialPath)
      Suggests possible path completions based on a partial path.
      Parameters:
      partialPath - The partial path to get suggestions for. If null or empty, returns all top-level keys.
      Returns:
      A List of suggested complete paths that match the partial path.

    • query

      public List<Object> query(String pattern)
      Queries JSON using wildcard patterns
      Parameters:
      pattern - The wildcard pattern (e.g., "user.*.city")
      Returns:
      List of matching values

    • filterArray

      public JsonArrayDot filterArray(String path, Predicate<Object> condition) throws org.json.JSONException
      Filters an array at the given path based on a condition
      Parameters:
      path - Path to the array
      condition - Predicate to filter array elements
      Returns:
      Filtered JsonArrayDot instance
      Throws:
      org.json.JSONException

    • pathToXml

      public String pathToXml(String path) throws org.json.JSONException
      Converts a specific path in the JSON object to XML
      Parameters:
      path - The path to convert
      Returns:
      XML string representation of the specified path
      Throws:
      org.json.JSONException - if conversion fails or path is invalid

    • addElementToArray

      public JsonDot addElementToArray(String path, String key, Object value) throws org.json.JSONException
      Adds a value to all elements in an array at the specified path
      Parameters:
      path - The path to the array (e.g., "user.contacts")
      key - The key to add to each array element
      value - The value to add
      Returns:
      this JsonDot instance for method chaining
      Throws:
      org.json.JSONException - if the path is invalid or does not point to an array

    • addElementToAllPaths

      public JsonDot addElementToAllPaths(String path, Object value) throws org.json.JSONException
      Adds a value at all matching paths using dot notation, auto-creating missing paths
      Parameters:
      path - Dot notation path (e.g., "*.child" or "parent1.parent2.child")
      value - Value to add
      Returns:
      this JsonDot instance for method chaining
      Throws:
      org.json.JSONException - if the path is invalid

    • findMatchingPaths

      public List<String> findMatchingPaths(String path) throws org.json.JSONException
      Finds all matching paths for a given pattern
      Parameters:
      path - The path pattern to match (e.g., "*.tags")
      Returns:
      List of matching paths
      Throws:
      org.json.JSONException - if the path is invalid

      org.json.JSONException

    • get

      public Object get(String path) throws org.json.JSONException
      Gets a value from the JSON object using dot notation
      Parameters:
      path - Dot notation path to the value
      Returns:
      The value at the specified path
      Throws:
      org.json.JSONException - if the path is invalid or the value doesn't exist

    • isNull

      public boolean isNull(String path) throws org.json.JSONException
      Checks if a value at the specified path is null
      Parameters:
      path - Dot notation path to check
      Returns:
      true if the value is null, false otherwise
      Throws:
      org.json.JSONException - if the path is invalid

      public org.json.JSONArray getJSONArray(String path) throws org.json.JSONException
      Gets a JSONArray from the JSON object using dot notation
      Parameters:
      path - Dot notation path to the array
      Returns:
      The JSONArray at the specified path
      Throws:
      org.json.JSONException - if the path is invalid or the value is not an array

    • getJSONObject

      public org.json.JSONObject getJSONObject(String path) throws org.json.JSONException
      Gets a JSONObject from the JSON object using dot notation
      Parameters:
      path - Dot notation path to the object
      Returns:
      The JSONObject at the specified path
      Throws:
      org.json.JSONException - if the path is invalid or the value is not an object

    • diff

      public List<JsonUtils.JsonDiff> diff(JsonDot other)
      Compares this JsonDot object with another and returns their differences
      Parameters:
      other - The other JsonDot object to compare with
      Returns:
      List of differences between the two JSON objects
